clinical_study.brief_title: Communicating Evidence From Systematic Reviews to the Public
clinical_study.official_title: Communicating Evidence From Systematic Reviews to the Public: A Randomised Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian Knowledge Centre for the Health Services

clinical_study.source: Norwegian Knowledge Centre for the Health Services

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this randomised controlled trial is to compare a new standardised summary format for presentation of synthesised evidence from systematic reviews for the public (a new plain language summary format) to the current format used in Cochrane systematic reviews. The study will evaluate if the new presentation improves understanding about the benefits and harms of an intervention, if it improves the accessibility of the information, and if it is preferred over other versions by the public over the current format.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Average proportion of people who answered 5 multiple choice questions correctly. Each question includes five response options about the number of people who could benefit or be harmed by the intervention and about the quality of evidence

secondary_outcome.description: Total number of questions out of five questions for benefits and harms that were answered correctly

other_outcome.measure: Understanding of the purpose of the summary
other_outcome.description: A multiple choice question with three options

other_outcome.measure: Understanding the producer of the summary
other_outcome.description: A multiple choice question with three options

Five questions about whether information was easy to find and understand, reliable, and useful to someone making a decision. Measured using a 7 point Likert scale (strongly agree to strongly disagree).

other_outcome.measure: Preference for the new format or the old format

arm_group.description: New plain language summary format of a Cochrane systematic review
Plain Language Summary format for the public currently in use in Cochrane systematic reviews

intervention.description: New plain language summary includes qualitative and quantitative description of text (absolute effects and natural frequencies provided); quantitative results provided in a table; quality of the evidence according to GRADE provided in a table; question and answer format; follows principles of linguistic frameworks (e.g. progressive movements from introduction to 'bottom line')
Current plain language summary includes qualitative description of effects only; inconsistent description of the quality of the evidence; paragraph of text; inconsistent flow of information
